subject: Institutional mechanism for redressal of Inter-Ministerial pending issues on NH projects
text: 9Ray <7y WTTHrf xiferasrot (tew @Rdev #r RTTHrf HArT, HRa TrTFT) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) Trt Tn 0ft-5 Qa 6, dqzr-10, #RWT, 7f fcvft_ 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 3H9 /Phone 91-11-25074100 25074200 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/ Inter-Ministerial Coordination/2023 Policy Circular No. 1.3.4.29/ 2023 dated 25th April; 2023 {Decision taken on E-Office File No. NHAI/11041/04/2021-HR/ Admn:-| (Comp. No. 199883)} Sub: Institutional mechanism for redressal of Inter-Ministerial pending issues on NH projects reg: Inter-Ministerial coordination issues are major impediments which causes several road projects getting stuck/ delayed: To ensure expeditious and effective resolution of such Inter-Ministerial issues, Ministry of Road Transport & Highways is in the process of setting-up of an institutional mechanism for monthly monitoring thereof pertaining to projects handled by its three wings viz. Road NHAI and NHIDCL. In this regard, Ministry has desired that information on such coordination matters may be compiled by NHAI and sent to them regularly. 2 Therefore, to facilitate above, the following measures are decided to be adopted at NHAI with the approval of the Competent Authority: 1= All ROs   of NHAI shall identify and flag-off the pending Inter-Ministerial issues pertaining to projects under their jurisdiction. ROs shall ensure to upload/update such issues and their status on PMG portal regularly not later than by 15th of every month. ii, Information on the PMG Portal shall be downloaded by KPMG Team at NHAI Hq to prepare a standing agenda to be mandatorily placed before EC in its 4th Meeting every month for review. iii. After EC review, the final position shall be provided by KPMG Team to Coordination Division for onward monthly submission to Additional Secretary (Highways) , MoRTH for taking up with respective Ministries. 3. This issues with the approval of Competent Authority. 2804/12 (Sanjay Kumar Patel) General Manager (Coord.)
